text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to mention that the existence of a New York court injunction *may work against* the recognition of the Paris award based on a violation of public policy (Article V(2)(b)). V(2)(b)): US public policy favors arbitration (Mitsubishi), not comity to domestic injunctions overriding international awards.\" It does not mention the possibility that the injunction *could* be used as a public policy defense against enforcement, even if it ultimately argues that defense would fail.", "criterion_id": "f101b285-a1a0-4537-859b-11fe9252516e"}
